result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: This case dismissed and read in per resolution this date in 15CM179 and 16CF9.  Minutes taken in those matters.
Status conference on December 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

All cases called together (15FO166,16CF9,15CM40,15CM177, 15CM179). Defendant Tyler S. Fashun in court in custody from the RC jail, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA moves to sentence def. in case 15CM177 to count 1, Bail Jump, Misdemeanor.  Defendant pleas Guilty to count 1.  The rest of the counts will be dismissed and read in.  Court's colloquy on plea. Finding of Guilty.
Sentence:  Withhold sentence for 2 years probation on count 1.  All other counts are dismissed.
Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete treatment or eductional programs ordered by his agent; AODA assessment; and follow through with the recommendations; Contact with Brettlyn Harvell at discretion of agent and costs of the action be reduced to civil judgment. Counts 2 through 7 are dismissed and read in for purposes of jeapardy.  0 credits.
Court orders to enter JOC.
Other cases are scheduled for 12/14/16 at 3:30pm.
Status conference on December 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Several cases called together.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Tyler S. Fashun. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def unable to be here for reasons stated on the record.  Court allows def's non-appearance for those reasons.  Matters adj. to 12/14 at 9.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tyler S. Fashun in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:  15CM190/adjourned initial, 15CM40/status, 15CM136/status, 15CM179/initial, 15CM177/initial, and 15TR1490/intake.

In the cases with initial and adjourned initial appearances, Court states the charges with the Defense having waived formal reading.  NG pleas entered.  Status requested and set for 1/13 at 11.

Bond ordered amended in all of the cases with victim to state that contact by phone is permitted; also, incidental contact for child exchange is allowed.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference at 11-04-2015 11:00 am

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Tyler S. Fashun by written authorization for adj. initial in 15CM136 and status in 15CM40. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Forehand states she has extended an offer in these matters but asks for warrant, noting that law enforcement has been trying to serve him in other matters.  Atty. M objects to issuance of arrest warrant as she has a signed authorization to appear on his behalf; states she received ADA Forehand's offer two days ago and has not had a chance to go over it with her client.  NG pleas entered in 15CM136, formal reading having been waived.  Status in both matters set for 11/4 at 11.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
